p: The leaves are the anatomical part of the plant, whose consumption of large doses over a long period of time means less risk to health. Specifically, it presents a lethal dose for 50% of the population (DL50) at 17.8 g/kg body weight and 15.9 g/kg body weight for the aqueous extract, which can lead to an alteration of hematological parameters and spleen hypertrophy and thymus [ 36]. However, no adverse effects were reported in a human study conducted with whole leaf powder at up to a single dose of 50 g or in a study using 8 g per day dose for 40 days [ 55].
